channel.title: The Madbury Club | Making Things Since 2088.

item.title: Cosmic Exploration with Chet Brinkwater: Takara Bunyon
item.author: Peter Hironaka

item.title: Native Shoes: Native Tongue Issue One Point Zero: SS15 Campaign
item.author: Peter Hironaka
item.description: The earth is our home. The global precession is here. From sea level to mountain top, from core to surface, from longitude to latitude. And on behalf of our good friends at Native Shoes, Madbury embarked on a 3 part editorial production showcasing their finest footwear from their SS15 collection. TMC Grounds Crew at work. As you were.

item.title: Phillip T Annand
item.author: Peter Hironaka
item.description: Some say he was born in the woods and raised with Kodiak bear cubs. Others say he’s a glorified Boy Scout with particularly long limbs. Evidently, Chief Exploratory Officer Phillip T. Annand’s background is as mysterious as the journeys he embarks on. A scar on his left arm, in the shape of a cowbell, is said to reveal his true origins when prodded with tweezers drenched in rubbing alcohol. But that could also just be infection as a result of eating squirrels for the past two weeks.

item.title: Hyun Kim
item.author: Peter Hironaka
item.description: This is not Hyun’s first intergalactic rodeo. Prior to aligning forces with the Club, he led sieges on the thirteenth, fourteenth, and fifteenth moons in Saturn’s gravitational pull. These days, he spends much more time organizing instead of colonizing. As the elder statesmen in a gang of lollygaggers, Hyun is now tasked with making sure missions stay the course while managing to avoid, figuratively, pulling his hair out.

item.title: Marcus Arman
item.author: Peter Hironaka
item.description: Marcus Arman doesn’t remember his birthday. But he can recite the alphabet in sixty-four dialects, all of which date back to or before the standing of the Ottoman Empire. A chronic case of amnesia may make daily tasks quite difficult, but he’s not paid to know how to operate a vehicle or remember his eye color. He’s paid to ease communication between the past and present – something he does with the efficiency of three woodpeckers in a lumber-yard.

item.title: Peter Hironaka
item.author: Peter Hironaka
item.description: We discovered Peter playing golf on a course of his own design approximately four hours North of Los Angeles. “Chicks dig the long ball,” he winked before slicing a ball three-hundred yards. “Even if the sun is setting.” Following a brief conversation, he decided to leave the safety of his conventional job for the promise of the enticing inability to explain what it is he does to any suit-clad elder.

item.title: Darryl Richardson
item.author: Peter Hironaka
item.description: South Florida. Chefchaouen. Paris. Bogota. Peru. He is a man who does not believe in Zip Codes or resting his head some place for longer than a hummingbird’s heartbeat. Our Interalactic friend has made traveling the globe with a trustee 35mm his mission in life. Our newest member, and lifelong brother, Darryl.

item.title: Ellington Hammond
item.author: Peter Hironaka
item.description: Ellington Hammond, officially, is responsible for ensuring the optimal sound frequency and translation of ancient growls, moans, and cries. Though he’s most often found playing the voice of reason when missions go awry. No sir – you won’t catch him diving into questionably instable volcanic pits. But don’t mistake his sense for softness. Rumor has it that he once punched a manatee, off the coast of Djibouti, so hard that it swam backwards for the rest of its adult life. But shhh.

item.title: Vincent Picone
item.author: Peter Hironaka
item.description: Ask Mama Picone what Vinny does best and she’ll say he’s a helluva Pictionary player. Ask her what he does nearly as good and she’ll say take photos with that “light-box machine thingy.” And you know what they say: Mama knows best. Vinny’s knack for picture taking has steadily grown throughout the course of his twenty-five years. His process is methodical, at times, taking months on end to develop exposures that focus on framing more than the mythical subject he’s commissioned to capture. You may call him crazy – we call him brother

item.title: Bryan Stevenson
item.author: Peter Hironaka
item.description: You can’t win them all, except when you do. That saying has absolutely nothing to do with the life and times of Bryan Stevenson but it sure sounds cool. Anyways. The Club has changed some. But Bryan has changed the Club. A passing interest in doodling evolved into a full-fledged career in map-making, allowing him to chart territories of the world widely undiscovered and thus unknown to the greater public. His findings are legendary. But his story is untold. Just the way he intends it – for now.

item.title: 10 Deep VCTRY Holiday 2014 Lookbook

item.description: Chapter Two of a Three Part Lookbook extravaganza on behalf of our friends at 10 Deep.VCTRY Holiday 2014. View the complete lookbook HERE.

item.title: 10 Deep Core Holiday 2014 Lookbook
item.author: Peter Hironaka
item.description: The Intergalactic Madbury Club crossed cosmic paths with 10Deep for the first of three editorial experiments in support of their Holiday 2014 “Town & Country” collection. Photographed by TONE. Directed by PTA. Produced by Hyun Kim. Essential life force provided by Uncle Larry. East Coast, USA. 2014.
